lexUnit.name: glance.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a brief or hurried look

sentence.text: He cast a glance about him , noting the half-empty spaces of the undercroft , and the faint gleam of light from above-stairs .
A quick glance across the Channel will confirm that AV delivers none of these .
Stefan darted a suspicious glance across the table at him .
He flicked a glance across his shoulder .
There was a good deal of shrubbery trailed up the sides and it would have been difficult to see us by a casual glance along the terrace .
Heini nodded thanks and left the room , followed by his colleague , both giving piercing , policemen 's glances around the bar as they left .
Then he came downstairs , darting glances around him to see the enemy before he could be captured again .
Fox flicked a glance at it .
Don Edmonds cast a sideways glance at Philip Kelly , but answered for the Bureau .
A single glance at the actual contents of Mogridge 's cupboard embarrassed me .
He stole covert glances at her across the table .
His eyes made a swift study of her face , before he cast a glance at the sky .
It is plain from even a cursory glance at these figures that , after a slow start , CD-ROM is becoming a remarkable success .
Crouched down beside it , Delaney took another searching glance behind him , at the lifeless , cluttered room .
A quick glance between Rose and the girls was enough for them to know that it was better to make no mention of their elder brother .
One baleful glance from its enormous eyes could kill , as would its touch , while its breath would kill even birds which flew far overhead .
He averted his glance from the dead boy .
Her laugh was so loud it attracted glances from people in the room .
He gave her a swift glance from those pale , brilliant eyes , but said nothing .
They would frequently receive strange glances from those in other booths but she just ignored it .
Bill now shot a baleful glance in her direction .
He paused to throw another fierce glance in their direction .
Stealing a furtive glance into the mirror , Frankie was shocked to see another face , another pair of eyes in the glass .
The two women passed in the doorway and exchanged glances of pure gratitude .
She flashed Frau Geller and her companion a glance of the deepest loathing .
Lord Dacre cast his great-uncle a glance of acute dislike .
The boy kept his glance on the floor .
She quailed under his searing glance over her body .
He cast a furtive glance to left and to right .
After a while he gave her a sidelong glance under his enviable black lashes .
The old ladies cast one another knowing glances , somehow contriving to look at once smug and disapproving .
Matt bent a kindly glance upon Lucy .
She slid Dane a coquettish glance from beneath heavy black eyelashes .
He bolts off , down the wet lawn , without a backward glance .
